bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mona Rose, February 12, 1942

div1.p: Hench informs Rose that it will take some time to copy her photographs, but he assures her that he will take care of them.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mona Rose, February 12, 1942
div1.opener:
Y F.
February 12, 1942
My dear Miss Rose:
div1.p:
Incidentally, is your name Mona or June? Either
one looks all right to me.
I am glad the candy arrived.

This is just a note to tell you that our photo-
graphic department is very busy at the time and it may be
quite a little while before they get the photographs
copied. Please be patient with me. In the meantime,
they will be carefully taken care of.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. Miss Mona Rose
5450 West Walton Street
Chicago, Illinois
